about.text2: Specializing in software development, mobile applications, and automation, our team of experts works passionately to solve complex problems with elegance and efficiency.

contact.title: Let's Talk About
contact.subtitle: Ready to transform your business? Contact us for a free consultation.
contact.subject: Subject
contact.faqSubtitle: Everything you need to know before starting.
contact.faq1Q: How much does it cost to create a website?
contact.faq1A: The cost depends on the project complexity (showcase, e-commerce, web application). Our rates start from 80,000 FCFA for a showcase site. Contact us for a free and personalized quote adapted to your budget.
contact.faq2A: Yes, we offer monthly maintenance packages (VIP Webmaster Service) to ensure security, updates, backups, and small modifications to your site or application.
contact.faq3A: A standard showcase site generally takes 2 to 3 weeks. Complex applications like our products (LOGis, Intercity) may require 2 to 6 months of custom development depending on functionality.
contact.faq4Q: Do you work with clients outside Cameroon?
contact.faq4A: Absolutely! We work with clients across Africa and beyond. Our collaboration tools allow us to efficiently manage projects remotely.
contact.formSubtitle: Fill out the form and we'll respond within 24h.

faqPage.title: FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions | BOMIL SOLUTIONS
faqPage.description: Answers to frequently asked questions about our web and mobile development services in Cameroon
faqPage.q1: How much does it cost to develop a website in Cameroon?
faqPage.a1: Web development prices in Cameroon vary based on complexity: a showcase site costs between 300,000 and 1,500,000 FCFA, and an e-commerce site between 1,500,000 and 5,000,000 FCFA. BOMIL SOLUTIONS offers free personalized quotes.
faqPage.q2: How long does it take to develop a mobile application?
faqPage.a2: Mobile app development generally takes between 2 and 6 months depending on complexity. A simple app can be delivered in 6-8 weeks, while complex apps with a backend can take 4-6 months.
faqPage.q3: What technologies do you use for web development?
faqPage.a3: BOMIL SOLUTIONS masters modern technologies: React, Vue.js, Angular (Frontend); Node.js, Laravel, Django (Backend); MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB (Database). We choose the stack best suited for your project.
faqPage.q4: Do you offer maintenance after delivery?
faqPage.a4: Yes, BOMIL SOLUTIONS offers monthly maintenance contracts including: security updates, bug fixes, daily backups, 24/7 monitoring, and technical support. Rates start at 50,000 FCFA/month.
faqPage.q5: Do you develop Android and iOS applications?
faqPage.a5: Yes, we develop native apps (Swift for iOS, Kotlin for Android) and hybrid apps (React Native, Flutter). Hybrid apps allow targeting both iOS and Android with a single codebase, reducing costs by 40%.
faqPage.q6: Where are you located in Cameroon?
faqPage.a6: BOMIL SOLUTIONS is based in Yaoundé, Jouvence District. We receive clients by appointment and also operate in Douala and throughout Central Africa. Contact: +237 691 691 603.
faqPage.q7: What are Lucid, LOGis, and Intercity?
faqPage.a7: These are our business software solutions: Lucid for invoicing/stock management; LOGis for international transit agencies; Intercity for intercity transport management. All are adapted to the Cameroonian context.
faqPage.q8: Do you accept payments in installments?
faqPage.a8: Yes, we offer payment facilities: 30% at signing, 40% mid-project, 30% at delivery. For large projects, we can establish a personalized schedule. We accept transfers, Mobile Money, and cash.
faqPage.q9: Do you offer a guarantee on your developments?
faqPage.a9: Yes, all our projects include a 3-month guarantee after delivery covering bugs and malfunctions. We also offer 30 days of free support for team training and guidance.
faqPage.q10: Can I see examples of your work?
faqPage.a10: Yes, visit our portfolio on our website or contact us for a detailed presentation. We have completed over 50 projects for clients in Cameroon and Central Africa across various sectors.
